aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.content: Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (Computer and Information Systems concentration – Tidar University) specializing in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Systems, and Software Development. Experienced in designing and implementing Deep Learning–based systems, developing web and mobile applications, and managing databases. Skilled in problem-solving, teamwork, and adaptability to create efficient and innovative solutions. Passionate about leveraging AI and emerging technologies to build impactful products that bridge the gap between engineering and real-world applications. Continuously seeking opportunities to grow, collaborate, and contribute to innovative projects.

items.name: Portfolio Web - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: A personal portfolio website designed as a digital CV and project showcase. It highlights profile, skills, certifications, and projects with interactive components and a modern design.

details.overview: Developed with Next.js 14 (App Router) and React as the core framework, styled using TailwindCSS for modern responsive design, and enhanced with Framer Motion for smooth animations. Integrated Swiper.js for interactive carousel components and Context API for state management, including multi-language toggle (English, Indonesian, Korean, Japanese). Project data is dynamically loaded from JSON to ensure scalability and easy maintenance. Deployed on Vercel with SEO optimization and responsive design across all devices.

Frontend: Next.js 14 with App Router for modern React-based development
React 18 with Server Components for optimized rendering
Framer Motion for smooth page transitions and animations
Swiper.js for coverflow carousel and image galleries
Responsive grid-based layout optimized for all screen sizes
Functionality: Multi-language support (English, Indonesian, Korean, Japanese) via Context API
Dynamic content loading from JSON (skills, certifications, projects, experiences)
Interactive modals for detailed project and experience showcase
Image zoom gallery with Swiper integration
Escape key listener to close modals and galleries
Performance & SEO: Optimized build with Next.js Image and code-splitting
Meta tags and structured data for SEO
Lazy loading for images and components
“Ease of Management & Scalability”: Centralized language and data management via JSON + Context API
Reusable components for sections, cards, and modals
Scalable folder structure for easy future extension

items.name: D’SIBI Camera - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: A real-time detection system for SIBI (Indonesian Sign Language) gestures using YOLOv8. Designed to recognize hand gestures A–Z with high accuracy and provide an assistive tool for communication and learning.

details.overview: D’SIBI Camera is an AI-based application developed for real-time detection of SIBI (Indonesian Sign Language) alphabets A–Z using deep learning methods YOLOv8 and SSD. The system was trained on a dataset of 2600 images (100 per class) collected from multiple participants with varied distances and angles, including dynamic letters (J and Z) extracted from video. Achieving over 90% accuracy, it runs on webcam or smartphone input (via DroidCam), supports automatic video recording with bounding boxes, labels, confidence scores, and FPS overlay. Designed for inclusive communication, educational support in special schools, and research on sign language recognition, the system requires Python 3.8+, 8GB RAM, and GPU acceleration for optimal performance.

Detection: Real-time detection of SIBI alphabets A–Z with high accuracy
Bounding boxes around detected hand gestures
Confidence score shown for each prediction
FPS (frames per second) counter displayed during detection
Controls: Press 'S' → save snapshot with label and confidence to captures/ folder
Press 'Q' → exit program safely, close camera window, and release resources
Recording: Automatic video recording from the moment detection starts
Video saved in records/ directory with sequential naming (record_sibi1.mp4, record_sibi2.mp4, ...)
Each frame includes bounding box, label, confidence score, and FPS overlay
Dataset: 100 images per class collected from 2 participants
Variations in distance, hand position, and camera angle
Dynamic letters (J and Z) extracted from video frames
System Requirements: Python 3.8+ with required libraries (OpenCV, Ultralytics YOLO, etc.)
GPU recommended: NVIDIA for optimal performance
Use Cases: Assistive technology for deaf and hard-of-hearing communication
Learning aid for SIBI in special education schools (SLB)
Research tool for sign language recognition in Indonesia

items.name: WaafStock Mobile - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: Android mobile app built with Java and Volley for staff and managers. Supports item requests, approvals, stock monitoring, and transaction history synchronized with WaafStock Server API.

details.overview: The WaafStock Mobile Application is the Android version of the WaafStock inventory system, developed using Java with Volley API integration. It provides a streamlined and user-friendly interface for both staff and managers to manage stock-related activities directly from their mobile devices. The mobile app is fully integrated with the WaafStock Server API, ensuring real-time synchronization with the web platform. Staff can securely log in, submit item requests, view stock availability, and track the status of their requests, while managers can log in, review request lists, approve or reject requests, and monitor stock levels. The system ensures role-based access, centralized data, and seamless cross-platform usage.

Staff Role: Secure login using staff credentials validated against the database
Submit new item requests via a simple and responsive mobile form
View available inventory stock in real-time
Check request status: pending, approved, or rejected
Access personal request history for accountability and transparency
Manager Role: Login with manager credentials for secure access
Review list of pending requests submitted by staff
Approve or reject requests directly from the mobile app
Monitor current stock levels and availability
Access complete request and approval history for auditing purposes
Integration: Volley library for efficient REST API communication
Secure JSON-based response handling with error validation
Real-time synchronization between mobile and web platforms via WaafStock Server API
Cross-platform consistency to ensure data integrity across devices

items.name: WaafStock Web - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: Web platform with Manager and Staff roles for inventory and request management. Provides dashboards, charts, and history with REST API integration.

details.overview: The WaafStock Web Application is designed as the main interface for inventory and request management. Built with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (Fetch API) and integrated with the WaafStock Server REST API, it offers a responsive and role-based environment for both staff and managers. Staff users can log in to submit requests, check stock, and track personal histories, while managers are equipped with dashboards, approval workflows, and monitoring tools to oversee inventory and staff activity. The platform features data visualization through charts and logs, providing managers with insights into inventory trends and request statistics, while ensuring transparency and accountability across the system.

Manager Role: Login with manager credentials to access the system securely
Dashboard with real-time charts showing total requests, approval ratios, and stock trends
Approve or reject item requests submitted by staff
View and monitor inventory stock levels (read-only, updates done by Admin)
Access complete request history, filterable by user, date, or item
Transparent audit trail for tracking decisions and accountability
Staff Role: Submit new item requests through a structured request form
Check request status in real-time (pending, approved, rejected)
View available stock for informed requests
Access personal history of requests and approvals for record keeping
Integration: Fetch API for REST API calls with structured JSON responses
Role-based separation of features (Manager vs. Staff) for security and clarity
Centralized data management through WaafStock Server API

items.name: WaafStock Server - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: Backend system built with Node.js and Express providing REST API. Handles authentication, role-based access, inventory management, and request tracking with secure JWT authorization.

details.overview: The WaafStock Server is the backbone of the entire WaafStock system, built with Node.js and Express, and powered by a centralized MySQL database. It provides a REST API for both the web and mobile applications, enabling secure authentication, inventory management, request handling, and auditing. The server enforces role-based access through JWT authentication, ensuring staff, managers, and administrators only access features appropriate to their roles. Administrators have full control over user accounts, inventory data, and request histories, while managers handle approvals and staff focus on submitting requests. With features such as CRUD operations, history tracking, and request statistics, the server ensures secure, transparent, and efficient inventory management across platforms.

Admin Role: Full control over the system with centralized administration
Manage all registered accounts (Manager & Staff) with CRUD operations
CRUD operations for inventory items (add new items, update stock levels, delete items)
Access the entire request history across the system
Generate and view statistics (total requests, approved, pending, rejected)
Visualized reports with bar charts for decision-making insights
Manager Role: Approve or reject requests submitted by staff
View inventory stock (read-only access, updates handled by Admin)
Access request history with detailed filtering by user, item, or date
Dashboard with insights such as total requests and approval ratios
Maintain transparency through role-specific decision logs
Staff Role: Submit item requests to managers for approval
Track status of requests (pending, approved, rejected)
Access personal request and approval history anytime
API Services: REST API with structured JSON response format
Secure and scalable database with MySQL for centralized stock management
Cross-platform support, powering both web and mobile clients
Error handling and secure response validation for reliability

items.name: Automatic Curtain Control System - Magelang, Indonesia
items.description: Microcontroller-based system for automatic curtain control using ATmega16. Uses light sensor input to drive a servo motor, enabling smart and energy-efficient automation.

details.overview: The Automatic Curtain Control System is an IoT prototype developed as a smart home automation project. It uses an ATmega16 microcontroller programmed in C to control curtain movement based on ambient light intensity. An LDR (Light Dependent Resistor) sensor continuously detects light levels, and the system automatically opens or closes the curtain by driving a servo motor. This allows natural sunlight optimization during the day and privacy at night, reducing the need for manual curtain operation. The system was designed, simulated, and tested using Proteus before being implemented as a working hardware prototype, showcasing integration between sensors, microcontrollers, and actuators in a real-world environment.

Hardware: ATmega16 microcontroller as the main controller
LDR sensor to measure ambient light intensity
Servo motor connected to the curtain rail for opening and closing
Voltage regulator circuit to stabilize power supply
Prototype hardware tested on breadboard and then integrated into demo model
Software: Custom logic to interpret LDR readings into servo motor control signals
Threshold-based system to decide open/close positions automatically
Simulation and circuit design in Proteus software
Step-by-step debugging and live demo validation with real hardware
Functional: Curtains open automatically when ambient light exceeds a set threshold
Curtains close automatically when light levels fall below the threshold
Manual override possible via microcontroller reset or reprogramming
Energy-saving by maximizing natural lighting during the day
Low-cost and scalable IoT prototype for smart home applications
